sen.j: 船木荘（ふなきのしょう）は、平安時代～室町時代にかけて美濃国にあった荘園。
sen.e: Funaki-no-sho Estate is a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) existed in Mino Province during the Heian and Muromachi Periods.
Funaki-no-sho Estate was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) that existed in Mino Province during the Heian and Muromachi Periods.
Funaki-no-sho Manor was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) that existed in Mino Province during the Heian and Muromachi Periods.
It was an estate of Hojo-ji Temple
It was an estate of Hojo-ji Temple
It was an estate of Hojo-ji Temple
Motosu Country, Mino Province.
Motosu District, Mino Province.
Motosu District, Mino Province.

sen.j: 現在の岐阜県本巣市南西部と瑞穂市北西部付近。
sen.e: It was extended from the present southwestern area of Motosu City to the vicinity of northwestern area of Mizuho City in Gifu Prefecture.
It was located in the modern-day vicinity of the southwestern area of Motosu City and the northwestern area of Mizuho City in Gifu Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように書直し
sen.e: It was located in the modern-day vicinity of the southwestern area of Motosu City and the northwestern area of Mizuho City in Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: かつての中山道美江寺宿が中心地と推測されている。
sen.e: It is supposed that its central area was situated in old Mieji-shuku post station on the Nakasendo Way.
It is speculated that the old Mieji-shuku post station on the Nakasendo Way was at its center.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように書直し
sen.e: It is speculated that the old Mieji-shuku post station on the Nakasendo Way was at its center.
Unknown
Unknown
Unknown
Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: もとは高階基実の先祖相伝領。
sen.e: It was originally a TAKASHINA no Motozane's territory handed down from generation to generation.
sen.cmt: 先祖相伝領→定訳不明：territory handed down from generation to generationとしました。
sen.e: It was originally a territory handed down by the ancestors of TAKASHINA no Motozane.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように書直し
sen.e: It was originally a territory handed down by the ancestors of TAKASHINA no Motozane.
Head family
Head Family
Head Family
Hosho-ji Temple
Hosho-ji Temple
Hosho-ji Temple
Ryoke (a lord of the manor)
Ryoke (Lord of the Manor)
sen.cmt: ・Title caseにしました・不必要な「a」を削除
sen.e: Ryoke (Lord of the Manor)
Takashina clan
Takashina clan
Takashina clan

sen.j: 室町時代に地頭勢力に圧迫されたか。
sen.e: It is probable that the manor underwent the oppression of the jito (land steward appointed by the central military government to each of the estates (shoen) into which the countryside was divided).
sen.cmt: 地頭→jito (land steward appointed by the central military government to each of the estates (shoen) into which the countryside was divided) [http://encyclopedia2.thefreedictionary.com/jito]
sen.e: It is probable that the manor was oppressed by the force of the jito (manager and lord of a manor) during the Muromachi Period.
sen.cmt: ・「the」を補足・地頭を「jito (manager and lord of a manor)」にしました・「Period」→「period」
sen.e: It is probable that the manor was oppressed by the force of the jito (manager and lord of a manor) during the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代に東荘と西荘に分裂。
sen.e: During the Kamakura Period it split into To-no-sho (東荘: east manor) and Nishi-no-sho (西荘: west manor).
sen.cmt: 東荘→定訳・不明：To-no-sho (東荘: east manor) [正しい読み方不明です] 西荘→定訳不明： Nishi-no-sho (西荘: west manor) [正しい読み方不明です]
sen.e: During the Kamakura period it split into To-no-sho (東荘: east manor) and Nishi-no-sho (西荘: west manor).
During the Kamakura period it split into To-no-sho (東荘: east manor) and Nishi-no-sho (西荘: west manor).
